channel.title: screen shake
channel.description:
dont know if already mentioned. but only a few weeks ago cs:go finally found its roots again and implemented screen shake.
now screenshake is what made CS feel so fantastic.
i honestly cant tell if HL has it, and i am just to lazy to check it out. but what i know: screenshake is a musthave for every shootergame. it is the one reason why CS felt so much better compared to other shooters.
so will it be in there? will it be at least optional? or is BM going to have a lot of distance to CS-behavior and recoil ?

item.title: screen shake
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
But does it ruin it for you if the view recenters after the punch without you having to manually do it yourself?

I hate the way the recoil works in Counter-Strike, because I find constantly moving the camera annoying, it’s too easy to counter with scripts & is stupid how it just quits when looking straight up. I’m fine with the recoil in Half-Life (except for HL:S’ MP5 & HL2’s AR2) because the camera stays pointing in the same location.

The “two schools of thought” 6Sigma mentioned are really “I’m in the head of the person holding the gun, he aims where I look, I don’t look where he aims” vs “I might as well be a camera taped to an almost disembodied gun”.

item.title: screen shake
item.dc:creator: Bjossi
item.description:
6Sigma:

I guess there are two schools of thought when it comes to the whole ‘screen-shake’ issue. One says “Do it! it’s closer than I’ll ever be to a real-world environment in which I hurry someplace to do something!”. The other side of the coin mandates “I want my willing suspension of disbelief, but I’m the Avatar, therefore physics apply to everything and everyone BUT me.” When it comes to weapons, their operation under stress, and that perception as a visual experience, it works. Kind of. But I’m the hero in this movie; I call the shots, and I would include a radio button that anticipates recoil mitigation. Proper sight alignment. And an acceptance of the fact that a ‘Hazard Suit’ doesn’t just detect radiation.

For me the appeal of screen shakes has nothing to do with realism. Gun shots just feel more satisfying when they kick the view around. Same goes for damage feedback. Just take Quake for an example, walk up to an explosive box and shoot it, the screen will go very red and your view gets a mean punch downwards (as far as I can see) for a moment. That explosion would not seem nearly as mean if all you got was Quakeguy doing his pain grunt but the view was completely unaffected.
